tabs.title: Planform
tabs.help:
The wing planform is defined by adding a leading edge line and a trailing edge line.
Each line can have multiple points to create complex wing shapes.
Points on each line are declared using (x,y) coordinates.

entry_parts.title: Planform Point
entry_parts.help: A point on the leading or trailing edge of the wing

attributes.title: LE or TE
attributes.help: Select Leading Edge or Trailing Edge

attributes.title: X Position
attributes.help: The X position of the planform point in mm

attributes.title: Y Position
attributes.help: The Y position of the planform point in mm

attributes.title: XY File
attributes.help:
The text file from which to load the coordinates.
One coordinate per line with either whitespace or comma separation of x & y.

attributes.title: P1 X
attributes.help: x coordinate of P1 (start point) of the bezier

attributes.title: P1 Y
attributes.help: y coordinate of P1 (start point) of the bezier

attributes.title: P2 X
attributes.help: x coordinate of P2 (control point 1) of the bezier

attributes.title: P2 Y
attributes.help: y coordinate of P2 (control point 1) of the bezier

attributes.title: P3 X
attributes.help: x coordinate of P3 (control point 2) of the bezier

attributes.title: P3 Y
attributes.help: y coordinate of P3 (control point 2) of the bezier

attributes.title: P4 X
attributes.help: x coordinate of P4 (end point) of the bezier

attributes.title: P4 Y
attributes.help: y coordinate of P4 (end point) of the bezier

attributes.title: # Points
attributes.help: The number of points to render in the curve

attributes.title: Notes
attributes.help: Make your own notes here

entry_parts.title: Planform X/Y File
entry_parts.help:
Load a text file containing (x,y) coordinates for either LE or TE.
One coordinate per line with either whitespace or comma separation of x & y.

attributes.title: LE or TE
attributes.help: Select Leading Edge or Trailing Edge

attributes.title: X Position
attributes.help: The X position of the planform point in mm

attributes.title: Y Position
attributes.help: The Y position of the planform point in mm

attributes.title: XY File
attributes.help:
The text file from which to load the coordinates.
One coordinate per line with either whitespace or comma separation of x & y.

attributes.title: P1 X
attributes.help: x coordinate of P1 (start point) of the bezier

attributes.title: P1 Y
attributes.help: y coordinate of P1 (start point) of the bezier

attributes.help: x coordinate of P2 (control point 1) of the bezier

attributes.title: P2 Y

attributes.title: P3 X
attributes.help: x coordinate of P3 (control point 2) of the bezier

attributes.title: P3 Y
attributes.help: y coordinate of P3 (control point 2) of the bezier

attributes.title: P4 X
attributes.help: x coordinate of P4 (end point) of the bezier

attributes.title: P4 Y
attributes.help: y coordinate of P4 (end point) of the bezier

attributes.title: # Points
attributes.help: The number of points to render in the curve

attributes.title: Notes
attributes.help: Make your own notes here

entry_parts.title: Cubic Bezier
entry_parts.help: A cubic bezier defined by 4 points.

attributes.title: LE or TE
attributes.help: Select Leading Edge or Trailing Edge

attributes.title: X Position
attributes.help: Set this to the same as P1X

attributes.title: Y Position
attributes.help: The Y position of the planform point in mm

attributes.title: XY File
attributes.help:
The text file from which to load the coordinates.
One coordinate per line with either whitespace or comma separation of x & y.

attributes.title: P1 X
attributes.help: x coordinate of P1 (start point) of the bezier

attributes.title: P1 Y
attributes.help: y coordinate of P1 (start point) of the bezier

attributes.title: P2 X
attributes.help: x coordinate of P2 (control point 1) of the bezier

attributes.title: P2 Y
attributes.help: y coordinate of P2 (control point 1) of the bezier

attributes.title: P3 X
attributes.help: x coordinate of P3 (control point 2) of the bezier

attributes.title: P3 Y
attributes.help: y coordinate of P3 (control point 2) of the bezier

attributes.title: P4 X
attributes.help: x coordinate of P4 (end point) of the bezier

attributes.title: P4 Y
attributes.help: y coordinate of P4 (end point) of the bezier

attributes.title: # Points
attributes.help: The number of points to render in the curve

attributes.title: Notes
attributes.help: Make your own notes here

tabs.title: Airfoils
tabs.help:
Define the airfoil section at positions along the wing.
At least two airfoil sections should be defined, one at the root
 and one at the tip of the wing. ACAD will automatically blend
between the sections across the wing.

entry_parts.title: Airfoil Section
entry_parts.help: Defines the external airfoil at this X point on the wing

attributes.title: X Position
attributes.help: The X position of the airfoil in mm

attributes.title: Airfoil File
attributes.help:
The file the airfoil is to be loaded from. Note that,
once opened, the airfoil is stored within ACAD and future
access to the .dat file is not required.  Both Selig and
Lednicker file formats are supported.

attributes.title: Invert Airfoil?
attributes.help:
Invert the airfoil, allowing you to design a wing
which can be built upside down on the building board.
THIS MUST BE SET BEFORE OPENING THE AIRFOIL DAT FILE.

attributes.title: Notes
attributes.help: Make your own notes here

tabs.title: Ribs
tabs.help: Define the ribs, rib doublers and spacers of the wing

entry_parts.title: Rib
entry_parts.help: A single rib on a line between the leading and trailing edge

attributes.title: Index
attributes.help: Unique index used to link ribs and their doublers

attributes.title: Link To
attributes.help: The rib with which this part is linked

attributes.title: TE X
attributes.help: The X position of the rib at the trailing edge

attributes.title: LE X
attributes.help: The X position of the rib at the leading edge

attributes.title: Thickness
attributes.help: The thickness of the rib material

attributes.title: Wing Skin
attributes.help: The thickness of the wing skin at this rib

attributes.title: LE Width
attributes.help:
This dimension will be cut off the front of the rib
when it is first generated (subsequent tasks may
shorten the rib further).

attributes.title: TE Width
attributes.help: This dimension will be cut off the rear of the rib\nwhen it is first generated (subsequent tasks may\nshorten the rib further).

attributes.title: Add Holes?
attributes.help: Set to yes if this rib should have lightening holes added

attributes.title: LH Border
attributes.help: Lightening hole border width (the amount of rib material left around the hole)

attributes.title: MHL
attributes.help: Maximum length of a lightening hole - longer holes will be split

attributes.title: Sheeting Jig
attributes.help: Set to yes if this rib should have a sheeting jig

attributes.title: L / R
attributes.help: Select whether the doubler should be to the left or right of the linked rib

attributes.title: Split Along Chord Line?
attributes.help: Split the part into two parts along its chord line

attributes.title: Notes
attributes.help: Make your own notes here

entry_parts.title: Doubler
entry_parts.help: Associated with a rib by the Index field, this is a shorthand way to enter rib doublers

attributes.title: Index
attributes.help: Unique index used to link ribs and their doublers

attributes.title: Link To
attributes.help:
The rib with which this part is linked. This may be a
rib or another doubler.

attributes.title: Thickness
attributes.help: The thickness of the doubler material

attributes.title: LE Width
attributes.help: This dimension will be cut off the front of the doubler

attributes.title: TE Width
attributes.help: This dimension will be cut off the rear of the doubler

attributes.title: Add Holes?
attributes.help:
Set to yes if this doubler should have lightening holes added.
If set to No, the associated rib will also have holes excluded
where the doubler is attached to it; if set to Yes, a border
will be created to ensure the rib and doubler can be glued together.

attributes.title: L / R
attributes.help: Select whether the doubler should be to the left or right of the linked rib

attributes.title: Split Along Chord Line?
attributes.help: Split the part into two parts along its chord line

attributes.title: Notes
attributes.help: Make your own notes here

entry_parts.title: Spacer
entry_parts.help:
Spacers can be used to generate, for example, wing tip blocks and 
standoffs for butting root ribs to fuselage sides.
They do not interact with spars or other parts.

attributes.title: TE X
attributes.help: The X position of the spacer at the trailing edge

attributes.title: LE X
attributes.help: The X position of the spacer at the leading edge

attributes.title: Thickness
attributes.help: The thickness of the spacer material

attributes.title: Wing Skin
attributes.help:
The thickness of the wing skin at this spacer.
Set this to a negative value oversize the spacer.

attributes.title: Add Holes?
attributes.help: Set to yes if this spacer should have lightening holes added

attributes.title: LH Border
attributes.help: Lightening hole border width

attributes.title: MHL
attributes.help: Maximum length of a lightening hole - longer holes will be split

attributes.title: Split Along Chord Line?
attributes.help: Split the part into two parts along its chord line

attributes.title: Notes
attributes.help: Make your own notes here

tabs.title: Geodetics
tabs.help: Geodetics are automatically generated ribs which zig-zag between normal ribs.  They are defined by two bounding lines in the plan view which cross one or more rib bays.  The first geodetic will join the first two ribs crossed by the lines, from the top line to the bottom line; the next geodetic will cross bay two from the bottom line to the top line. The start at bottom setting will reverse the zig-zag.

entry_parts.title: Geodetic Set
entry_parts.help: One set of geodetic ribs

attributes.title: Top Start X
attributes.help: The X position of the start of the top line (the line nearest the LE)

attributes.title: Top Start Y
attributes.help: The Y position of the start of the top line (the line nearest the LE)

attributes.title: Top End X
attributes.help: The X position of the end of the top line (the line nearest the LE)

attributes.title: Top End Y
attributes.help: The Y position of the end of the top line (the line nearest the LE)

attributes.title: Bot Start X
attributes.help: The X position of the start of the bottom line (the line nearest the TE)

attributes.title: Bot Start Y
attributes.help: The Y position of the start of the bottom line (the line nearest the TE)

attributes.title: Bot End X
attributes.help: The X position of the end of the bottom line (the line nearest the TE)

attributes.title: Bot End Y
attributes.help: The Y position of the end of the bottom line (the line nearest the TE)

attributes.title: Start at...?
attributes.help: Which line to start the geodetic zig-zag at

attributes.title: Thickness
attributes.help: The thickness of the geodetic rib material

attributes.title: Add Holes?
attributes.help: Set to yes if this rib should have lightening holes added

attributes.title: LH Border
attributes.help: Lightening hole border width

attributes.title: MHL
attributes.help: Maximum length of a lightening hole - longer holes will be split

attributes.title: Notes
attributes.help: Make your own notes here

tabs.title: Rib Params
tabs.help:
Keep Outs: Keep lightening holes out of width around where this line intersects a rib.
Washout: Define the washout between two positions on the wing.
  Multiple entries can be used to create complex washout profiles across the wing.
TE Thickness: Define the trailing edge thickness between two positions on the wing.
  Multiple entries can be used to vary the thickness profile across the wing.

entry_parts.title: Keep Out
entry_parts.help: Keep out for rib lightening holes

attributes.title: Start X
attributes.help: The X position of the start of the keep out line

attributes.title: Start Y
attributes.help: The Y position of the start of the keep out line

attributes.title: End X
attributes.help: The X position of the end of the keep out line

attributes.title: End Y
attributes.help: The Y position of the end of the keep out line

attributes.title: Width
attributes.help: Keep Out: The total width of the keep out - half either side of the line

attributes.title: Notes
attributes.help: Make your own notes here

entry_parts.title: Washout
entry_parts.help:
Washout between two X positions on the wing.  If the start and
end values of the washout are different, ACAD will 
blend between the two.

attributes.title: Start X
attributes.help: The X position of the start of the washout region

attributes.title: End X
attributes.help: The X position of the end of the washout region

attributes.title: Start Value
attributes.help: Washout: The washout in degrees at the Start X position. Positive is LE down & TE up.

attributes.title: End Value
attributes.help: Washout: The washout in degrees at the End X position. Positive is LE down & TE up.

attributes.title: WO Pivot Point
attributes.help: Washout: The rotation will be applied around this point on the rib

attributes.title: Notes
attributes.help: Make your own notes here

entry_parts.title: TE Thickness
entry_parts.help: TE thickness between two X positions on the wing.  If the start and\nend values of the TE Thickness are different, ACAD will \nblend between the two.

attributes.title: Start X
attributes.help: The X position of the start of the TE thickness region

attributes.title: End X
attributes.help: The X position of the end of the TE thickness region

attributes.title: Start Value
attributes.help: TE Thickness at the Start X position.

attributes.title: End Value
attributes.help: TE Thickness at the End X position.

attributes.title: TE Blend %
attributes.help: TE Thickness: Percentage of the chord to blend over; set to 0 to use default

attributes.title: Notes
attributes.help: Make your own notes here

tabs.title: Sheet Spars and Jigs
tabs.help:
Wing spars made from sheet material and building jigs
(jig-spars, rib supports and rib tabs)

entry_parts.title: Sheet Spar
entry_parts.help: A sheet spar, with both rib and spar slotted where they cross

attributes.title: Start X
attributes.help: The X position of the start of the spar

attributes.title: Start Y
attributes.help: The Y position of the start of the spar

attributes.title: End X
attributes.help: The X position of the end of the spar

attributes.title: End Y
attributes.help: The Y position of the end of the spar

attributes.title: Thickness
attributes.help: The thickness of the spar material

attributes.title: Slot %
attributes.help: The depth of the slot in the spar as a percentage of the spar height

attributes.title: Insert
attributes.help:
Insert from above or below.  For example, if ABOVE is selected
the rib will be slotted at the top and the spar
will be slotted at the bottom.

attributes.title: Widen Slots
attributes.help: widen slots to account for angled spar / rib intersections

attributes.title: Remove Material
attributes.help:
This setting can be used to make the spar into a false leading or
trailing edge by removing rib material in front of or behind the spar.

attributes.title: Holes?
attributes.help: Set to yes if this spar should have lightening holes added

attributes.title: LH Border
attributes.help: Lightening hole border width

attributes.title: MHL
attributes.help: Maximum length of a lightening hole - longer holes will be split

attributes.title: Tabs?
attributes.help:
Instead of slots at the front of the rib, use a tab with a matching hole in the spar.
This option should be used in conjunction with the Remove Material option.
Used for false leading edges.  Use a typical slot depth of 35%.

attributes.title: Rib S-Tab Width
attributes.help: The width of support tabs added to the bottom of ribs

attributes.title: Notes
attributes.help: Make your own notes here

entry_parts.title: Sheet Spar+Jig
entry_parts.help: A slotted sheet spar with material added below to support it whilst building

attributes.title: Start X
attributes.help: The X position of the start of the spar

attributes.title: Start Y
attributes.help: The Y position of the start of the spar

attributes.title: End X
attributes.help: The X position of the end of the spar

attributes.title: End Y
attributes.help: The Y position of the end of the spar

attributes.title: Thickness
attributes.help: The thickness of the spar material

attributes.title: Slot %
attributes.help: The depth of the slot in the spar as a percentage of the spar height

attributes.title: Widen Slots
attributes.help: widen slots to account for angled spar / rib intersections

attributes.title: Remove Material
attributes.help:
This setting can be used to make the spar into a false leading or
trailing edge by removing rib material in front of or behind the spar.

attributes.title: Holes?
attributes.help: Set to yes if this spar should have lightening holes added

attributes.title: LH Border
attributes.help: Lightening hole border width

attributes.title: MHL
attributes.help: Maximum length of a lightening hole - longer holes will be split

attributes.title: Tabs?
attributes.help: Instead of slots at the front of the rib, use a tab with a matching hole in the spar.\nThis option should be used in conjunction with the Remove Material option.\nUsed for false leading edges.  Use a typical slot depth of 35%.

attributes.title: Jig Height
attributes.help: The wing centreline height above the building board

attributes.title: Jig Sep %
attributes.help:
The percentage of the interib spacing by which the spar is joined to the jig;
will be split into two equal tabs of half this. Try 20%.

attributes.title: Rib S-Tab Width
attributes.help: The width of support tabs added to the bottom of ribs

attributes.title: Notes
attributes.help: Make your own notes here

entry_parts.title: Rib Support
entry_parts.help: A sheet piece with partial slots in for supporting ribs whilst building the wing

attributes.title: Start X
attributes.help: The X position of the start of the support

attributes.title: Start Y
attributes.help: The Y position of the start of the support

attributes.title: End X
attributes.help: The X position of the end of the support

attributes.title: End Y
attributes.help: The Y position of the end of the support

attributes.title: Thickness
attributes.help: The thickness of the rib support material

attributes.title: Jig Height
attributes.help: The wing centreline height above the building board

attributes.title: Rib S-Tab Width
attributes.help: The width of support tabs added to the bottom of ribs

attributes.title: Notes
attributes.help: Make your own notes here

entry_parts.title: Rib Support Tabs
entry_parts.help:
Tabs added to the bottom of ribs to support them during the build.
A tab is added to each rib intersected by the line.

attributes.title: Start X
attributes.help: The X position of the start of the tab line

attributes.title: Start Y
attributes.help: The Y position of the start of the tab line

attributes.title: End X
attributes.help: The X position of the end of the tab line

attributes.title: End Y
attributes.help: The Y position of the end of the tab line

attributes.title: Slot %
attributes.help: The width of the tab as a percentage of the chord

attributes.title: Jig Height
attributes.help: The wing centreline height above the building board

attributes.title: Rib S-Tab Width
attributes.help: The width of support tabs added to the bottom of ribs

attributes.title: Notes
attributes.help: Make your own notes here

tabs.title: Strip Spars
tabs.help: Spars made from rectangular strip with or without inter spar webs

entry_parts.title: Box Spar
entry_parts.help: Top and bottom strip spars with front and rear inter-spar webs

attributes.title: Start X
attributes.help: The X position of the start of the spar

attributes.title: Start Y
attributes.help: The Y position of the start of the spar

attributes.title: End X
attributes.help: The X position of the end of the spar

attributes.title: End Y
attributes.help: The Y position of the end of the spar

attributes.title: Spar Width
attributes.help: The width of the rectangular spar strips

attributes.title: Spar Depth
attributes.help: The depth of the rectangular spar strips

attributes.title: Web Thickness
attributes.help: The thickness of the material for the inter-spar webs

attributes.title: Web Position
attributes.help: Put the slotted spar part at the front, middle or rear of the strip spars

attributes.title: Slot %
attributes.help: The depth of the slot in the spar as a percentage of the spar height

attributes.title: Max Web Length
attributes.help:
If the inter-rib spacing is longer than this value, the web will be split.
This is useful for cutting the webs cross-grain from sheet stock of limited width.

attributes.title: Widen Slots
attributes.help: widen slots to account for angled spar / rib intersections

attributes.title: Notes
attributes.help: Make your own notes here

entry_parts.help: Top and bottom strip spars with a single inter-spar web between them.

attributes.title: Start Y
attributes.help: The Y position of the start of the spar

attributes.title: End X
attributes.help: The X position of the end of the spar

attributes.title: End Y
attributes.help: The Y position of the end of the spar

attributes.help: The width of the rectangular spar strips

attributes.title: Web Thickness

attributes.help:
If the inter-rib spacing is longer than this value, the web will be split.
This is useful for cutting the webs cross-grain from sheet stock of limited width.

attributes.title: Widen Slots
attributes.help: widen slots to account for angled spar / rib intersections

attributes.title: Start Y
attributes.help: The Y position of the start of the spar

attributes.title: End X
attributes.help: The X position of the end of the spar

attributes.title: End Y
attributes.help: The Y position of the end of the spar

attributes.title: Spar Width
attributes.help: The width of the rectangular spar strips

attributes.help: The depth of the rectangular spar strips

attributes.help: Put the slotted spar part at the front, middle or rear of the strip spars

entry_parts.title: Strip Spar
entry_parts.help: A single rectangular spar aligned with the outline of the rib; no webs.

attributes.title: Start X
attributes.help: The X position of the start of the spar

attributes.title: Start Y
attributes.help: The Y position of the start of the spar

attributes.title: End X
attributes.help: The X position of the end of the spar

attributes.title: End Y
attributes.help: The Y position of the end of the spar

attributes.title: Spar Width
attributes.help: The width of the rectangular spar strips

attributes.title: Spar Depth
attributes.help: The depth of the rectangular spar strips

attributes.title: Top or Bottom?
attributes.help: Place the spar in the top or bottom of the wing?

attributes.title: Web Position
attributes.help: Put the slotted spar part at the front, middle or rear of the strip spars

attributes.title: Slot %
attributes.help: The depth of the slot in the spar as a percentage of the spar height

attributes.title: Widen Slots
attributes.help: widen slots to account for angled spar / rib intersections

attributes.title: Notes
attributes.help: Make your own notes here

tabs.title: Elements
tabs.help:
Tubular or rectangular items in the wing (e.g., wing tubes or servo bearers). These are defined by a start and an end point much like spars.
They also have a Z component, which defines the vertical location in the wing.
This tab also allows alignment dots to be placed; these are two dots on ribs
and their sheeting jigs to help with alignment when building.

entry_parts.title: Rectangular Element
entry_parts.help: A rectangular element, such as a plate, a servo bearer or an undercarriage bar

attributes.title: Start X
attributes.help: The X position of the start of the element

attributes.title: Start Y
attributes.help: The Y position of the start of the element

attributes.title: Start Z
attributes.help: The Z position of the start of the element

attributes.title: End X
attributes.help: The X position of the end of the element

attributes.title: End Y
attributes.help: The Y position of the end of the element

attributes.title: End Z
attributes.help: The Z position of the end of the element

attributes.title: Width
attributes.help: Width of a rectangular element

attributes.title: Depth
attributes.help: Depth of a rectangular element

attributes.title: Angle
attributes.help: The angle of a rectangular element (degrees).  Set to 0 for horizontal.

attributes.title: Widen Slots
attributes.help: widen slots to account for angled spar / rib intersections

attributes.title: Z-Mode
attributes.help: Z-Mode tells ACAD how to interpret your Z values. CHOORD will position relative to chord line; SNAP-BOTTOM or SNAP-TOP will snap the element to the rib outline and then inset it by Z; ROTATE-BOTTOM or ROTATE-TOP will snap the element to the rib outline and rotate it to the angle of the rib outline, and then inset it by Z.

attributes.title: Notes
attributes.help: Make your own notes here

entry_parts.title: Tubular Element
entry_parts.help: A tubular element, such as a wing tube or a bolt hole

attributes.title: Start X
attributes.help: The X position of the start of the element

attributes.title: Start Y
attributes.help: The Y position of the start of the element

attributes.title: Start Z
attributes.help: The Z position of the start of the element

attributes.title: End X
attributes.help: The X position of the end of the element

attributes.title: End Y
attributes.help: The Y position of the end of the element

attributes.title: End Z
attributes.help: The Z position of the end of the element

attributes.title: Diameter
attributes.help: The diameter of a tubular element

attributes.title: Widen Slots
attributes.help: widen slots to account for angled spar / rib intersections

attributes.title: Z-Mode
attributes.help: Z-Mode tells ACAD how to interpret your Z values. CHOORD will position relative to chord line; SNAP-BOTTOM or SNAP-TOP will snap the element to the rib outline and then inset it by Z; ROTATE-BOTTOM or ROTATE-TOP will snap the element to the rib outline and rotate it to the angle of the rib outline, and then inset it by Z.

attributes.title: Notes
attributes.help: Make your own notes here

entry_parts.title: Alignment Dots
entry_parts.help: Small dots applied to ribs and sheeting jigs to help with alignment during the build

attributes.title: Start X
attributes.help: The X position of the start of the element

attributes.title: Start Y
attributes.help: The Y position of the start of the element

attributes.title: End X
attributes.help: The X position of the end of the element

attributes.title: End Y
attributes.help: The Y position of the end of the element

attributes.title: Dot Size
attributes.help: Dots will actually be a square with sides this long

attributes.title: Dot Inset
attributes.help: The distance dots are inset from the edge of the part.

attributes.title: Notes
attributes.help: Make your own notes here

tabs.title: SJC-1
tabs.help:
Configuration part-1 for the sheeting jigs. This tab allows definition of the
leading and trailing edge jig lines, the location of the central spar
 and the dimensions of the central spar.

entry_parts.title: Jig Configuration
entry_parts.help: Overall configuration for the sheeting jigs

attributes.title: LE Start X
attributes.help: This planform line should be placed in front of the end of the ribs in the planform by 10 - 20mm. It defines where the end structure of the jig starts.

attributes.title: LE Start Y

attributes.title: Spar Start X
attributes.help:
This is a single rectangular spar along the (roughly) the centre of the jig.  
It provides strength and also something to pin the jig to the building board with.

attributes.title: Spar Start Y
attributes.help:
This is a single rectangular spar along the (roughly) the centre of the jig.  
It provides strength and also something to pin the jig to the building board with.

This is a single rectangular spar along the (roughly) the centre of the jig.

attributes.title: Spar End Y
attributes.help:
This is a single rectangular spar along the (roughly) the centre of the jig.  
It provides strength and also something to pin the jig to the building board with.

attributes.title: Spar Width
attributes.help: The width of the bottom spar.

attributes.title: Spar Depth
attributes.help: The depth of the bottom spar.

tabs.title: SJC-2
tabs.help:
Configuration part-2 for the sheeting jigs. This tab allows definition of the
bars which clamp the skins at the leading and trailing edges,
plus the height of the centreline of the wing and the jig thickness.

entry_parts.title: Jig Configuration
entry_parts.help: Overall configuration for the sheeting jigs

attributes.title: LE Bar Width
attributes.help: The width of the clamping bar at the leading edge of the jig

attributes.title: LE Bar Depth
attributes.help: The depth of the clamping bar at the leading edge of the jig

attributes.title: TE Bar Width
attributes.help: The width of the clamping bar at the trailing edge of the jig

attributes.title: TE Bar Depth
attributes.help: The depth of the clamping bar at the trailing edge of the jig

attributes.title: Height Above Board
attributes.help: The height of the wing choord line above the building board when jigged.

attributes.title: Material Thickness
attributes.help: The thickness of the sheeting jig material.  ACAD needs to know this in order to widen the slots at angled joints.
